tag.description: A standard Facelets for performing Spring Security authorization decisions. The tag supports the following combinations attributes for authorization: access; url and method; ifAllGranted and ifAnyGranted and ifNotGranted. The var attribute can be used to store the result of the authorization decision for later use in the view.

attribute.description: A Spring-EL expression which is supported by the WebSecurityExpressionHandler in the application context. The latter will be used to evaluate the expression.
attribute.name: access

attribute.description: A URL within the application. If the user has access to this URL (as determined by the AccessDecisionManager), the tag body will be evaluated. If not, it will be skipped.
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: Can be used to specify the HTTP method (typically GET or POST) which is used in combination with the URL when consulting the AccessDecisionManager. Only has any meaning when used in combination with the "url" attribute. Defaults to GET.
attribute.name: method

attribute.description: A page scoped variable into which the boolean result of the tag evaluation will be written, allowing the same condition to be reused subsequently in the page without re-evaluation.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Check if authentication has any of authorities granted.
attribute.name: ifAnyGranted

attribute.description: Check if authentication has all of authorities granted.
attribute.name: ifAllGranted

attribute.description: Check if authentication has none of authorities granted.
attribute.name: ifNotGranted

tag.description: Verify if the user is authenticated.
Verify if no user is authenticated.
